response.answer_text: Electroplating is a process that uses an electric current to reduce dissolved metal cations so that they form a thin coherent metal coating on an electrode There are essentially two technologies: electroplating and electroless plating. In the electroplating process, the substrate is immersed in a liquid solution called an 'electrolyte'. Then, an electrical potential is applied between a conductive area on the substrate and an electrode

There are essentially two technologies: electroplating and electroless plating. In the electroplating process, the substrate is immersed in a liquid solution called an “electrolyte.” Then, an electrical potential is applied between a conductive area on the substrate and an electrode.

Simplified you can say that you apply a thin layer of metal to another metal. The metal layer is applied by have different electropotential, so the metal ions travels to the next metal  Beer taps with Au plating Plating Electroplating bath for electronic plating is “ purer” bath as they shall provide electric conductive layer Plating for decorative is called GMF (General Metal Finish) and hold some amount of polymer that takes away some small tinny marks and make surface smooth and glossy.
